snippet: The decision to prosecute Pu Zhiqiang, a widely respected figure, provides more evidence of the Chinese government’s determination to silence reform advocates.
abstract: Chinese authorities announce arrest of Pu Zhiqiang, well-known rights defender who took part in private seminar in May, in which participants discussed army's violent suppression of1989 protests in Tiananmen Square; decision to prosecute Pu is further evidence of government's determination to silence even moderate reform advocates.
lead_paragraph: The decision to prosecute Pu Zhiqiang, a widely respected figure, provides more evidence of the Chinese government’s determination to silence reform advocates.

headline.main: China to Prosecute Pu Zhiqiang for Activism
headline.print_headline: China Reports Rights Lawyer Faces Trial Over Activism

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
